description:
Senior Manager, Cloud Partnerships

Devo is the only cloud-native logging and security analytics platform that releases the full potential of your data to empower bold, confident action. With unrivaled scale to collect all of your data without compromise, speed to give you immediate access and answers, and clarity to focus on the signals that matter most, Devo is your ally in protecting your organization today and tomorrow. Headquartered in Cambridge, Mass., Devo is backed by Insight Partners, Georgian, TCV, General Atlantic, Bessemer Venture Partners, Kibo Ventures and Eurazeo. Learn more at www.devo.com.

Devo is proud to be recognized as a Great Place to Work®.

JOB DESCRIPTION

As the Senior Manager, Cloud Partnerships, you will have worldwide responsibility to manage Cloud Partnerships for Devo. You will manage strategy, sales, go-to-market, enablement, operations, and executive relationships to drive adoption of Devo within customers leveraging these partners cloud platforms. This role will be responsible to drive revenue for Devo by leveraging these cloud partnerships and their respective marketplace offerings.

Responsibilities

You will be responsible to drive the success of Devo’s cloud partnerships to ensure Devo is listed and promoted on the cloud providers store/marketplace, is promoted and discussed as the key log management and security analytics platform and also aligned to the providers future roadmap.

Specifically:
• Develop and implement the partnership strategy, including strategic sales and go-to market plans
• Develop and manage partner marketing programs, and collaborate with Sales and Marketing to execute partner marketing campaigns
• Manage programs to maximize sales revenue, touch, and influence for the cloud partner
• Represent Devo by driving business development initiatives
• Engage in business development and ongoing partner success
• Be accountable for partner sales quotas and partnership P&L
• Develop and actively maintain partner sales forecasts across assigned accounts and lines of business
• Measure and report results of partner plan execution
• Identify areas for improvement and act to implement positive change
• Manage development and execution of external and internal partner communications plans
• Collaborate with Sales, Products, and Marketing to develop new product offerings

In this role, you will build a critical mass of interest and enthusiasm for Devo’s technology and product offerings, and help to establish Devo as the enterprise wide log management and security analytics platform within the strategic cloud partners and other cloud partnerships worldwide. You will work with your partners to help target, identify, recruit and sell-to customers that are seeking an enterprise wide solution.

Who are we looking for?

The ideal person will have an existing network of partner contacts at the key providers like AWS, that they can call upon to help grow and expand Devo’s presence. This person will have excellent communication & negotiation skills to drive this channel. This person can multi-task, is self-motivated, while still interacting well with a team; is highly organized with high energy level and can-do attitude.

Requirements:
• 8+ years of experience in an alliance management role working with technology & cloud providers
• Experience as a business development leader, sales strategy, partner management, working with enterprise software products or services
• Ability to recruit, enable and drive business with cloud providers
• Recent familiarity or hands-on experience with:
• Security Software
• Cloud computing environments (AWS, Azure, and Google Compute)
• Log Management and SIEM basics
• Knowledge of general security practices, regulatory compliance requirements, organizational structures and corporate cultures.
• Certifications such as CISSP, SSSP are preferred

Compensation

This role will have a general pay range of $125,000.00 to $140,000.00. The provided base salary range is what we expect to pay a substantially qualified candidate, with final offer being based on the candidate’s relevant experience and skills, as well as location and other factors. Total compensation for the role will include base salary, as well as a bonus or commission target and an equity grant applicable to the level of the role.

Why work at Devo?
• You’ll join a Great Place to Work® certified company where we value our people and provide the tremendous opportunities that come with a hyper-growth organization.
• Be part of an international company with a strong team culture that celebrates success. Share our core values: Be bold - Be Inventive - Be humble - Be an ally.
• A flexible work environment that lets you work in the way that works best for you — in office, fully remote, or hybrid.
• Work in an environment that will challenge you and enable you to grow as a professional with training and professional development to help you reach your goals.
• Comprehensive Benefits including Healthcare 401K, Employee Stock Option plan, Employee referral program, and so much more!

"Devo is committed to creating a welcoming culture that is not only grounded in teamwork and customer success but is fair and equitable for everyone." Marc van Zadelhoff, CEO.

At Devo, diversity and inclusion means more than treating employees well and making them feel welcome. It is a commitment to hiring people who bring different insights because of their unique perspectives, ways of thinking, and prior experiences.

Devo does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act) with respect to employment opportunities.
